name: 0xDeadC0de Security Club
tagline: Central hub for all members of 0xDeadC0de Security Club
body:
This will be the main page for everyone to be able to find out what the latest new is for the club, meeting times, and any resources that the club uses (or members suggest)
``` !!!NEXT MEETING: (TENTATIVE) MARCH 26th!!! At the next meeting we will be having a Presentation (TBA) ```
###A Bit about 0xDC Sec Club Each meeting we are going to try and have either some type of Presentation and workshop (maybe both) In the planning to do some Open Source Projects, Competitions (CTFs, CCDC, ITC, etc) The Overall goal of 0xDeadC0de Security Club is to help its members to become knowledgeable and active members in the Information Security fields. This will include getting a deeper understanding for topics covered in class, learning programming languages, exposure to tools not covered in class and other areas of interest for club members in Information Security. Anyone is welcome to be a member and participate in the club events that is wanting to learn new information, or even contribute on a topic in which they are interested in. Member participation is what drives a club to either being successful or failure, so please participate as much as possible and get your friends involved.

###Possible Presentations: * Crypto-party * Web attacks * Defensive Tactics * Wi-Fi hacking * Memory Forensics * Malware Analysis * Network Security
###Resources: [CTF Time](https://ctftime.org/) is a great recourse for seeing upcoming CTFs and write-ups from previous CTF events [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/) site that will allow you to sign up for mailing lists on most resent vulnerabilities found
*** ###Information provided at meeting: [0xDC Sec Club Slides from first meeting 03262015](https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B6MwOlxphkIuLXp3ZTg0cFFRQjQ/view?usp=sharing)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
